page.title: 14INVERNESS ROYAL ACADEMY
page.content: Pupils who attend the I.R.A. come mainly from 4 primary schools in Inverness and country schools as far south as{WHITEBRIDGE}and{FOYERS.} Altogether with pupils, staff and auxiliary workers about 2000 people are involved in the day to day business of the school. Apart from the normal curriculum the Academy has lots of clubs and activities.There are football, rugby,hockey and shinty teams. There is ski_ing, orienteering, athletics and curling for the sports_minded and computer, chess, drama and dance for children who prefer less strenuous activities. Going to a large comprehensive can be, particularly for the country children, a frightening experience but the majority end up happy and secure in the school.
